title: Deepti, Amanjot fire as India crush Sri Lanka in Women’s World Cup opener
byline: A splendid all-round display saw India launch their ICC Women’s World Cup campaign on the front foot, brushing aside Sri Lanka by 59 runs in the curtain-raiser in Guwahati on Tuesday.

title: Deadly 6.9 magnitude earthquake strikes central Philippines
byline: A powerful 6.9-magnitude earthquake struck the central Philippines late Tuesday, killing people at a sports arena and raising fears of considerable destruction.

title: CID arrests suspect in Rs. 100M ‘Urumaya’ scam
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested a suspect connected to a massive ‘Urumaya’ deed certificate scam that defrauded over Rs. 100 million from hundreds of victims in the Eastern Province.

title: CAA warns public to report overpriced food at bus stop restaurants
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has urged the public to report instances of food and beverages being sold at prices higher than the stated rates at restaurants where long-distance buses stop for tea. Reports can be made via the CAA’s “1977” SMS service.

title: New Vithanakanda Tea Factory CEO returns after record-breaking sale
byline: The FF Extra Special Black Tea, presented by the New Vithanakanda Tea Factory and recognized by the Guinness World Records as the most valuable and expensive tea in the world, was successfully sold at an international auction. CEO Pubudu Gunasekara, who participated in the auction, arrived at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning.

title: Former policeman sentenced to 14 years for child sexual abuse
byline: Homagama High Court Judge Navaratna Marasinghe sentenced a former Borella police officer, who had been indicted for sexually abusing a girl under the age of 16, to 14 years of rigorous imprisonment.

title: U.S. sanctions stand in the way of realising Russia–Sri Lanka trade, tourism potential fully: Envoy
byline: The full potential of Russia–Sri Lanka bilateral trade and tourism cannot be realised because of U.S. sanctions, Russian Ambassador Levan Dzhagaryan said yesterday.

title: Nine months on: US $3.7Bn Sinopec investment in limbo
byline: Despite the lapse of nine months since the signing of the MoU, the government is yet to finalise the proposed US $3.7 billion investment by China’s Sinopec for a refinery facility in Hambantota, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: President returns from official Japan visit
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who was on an official visit to Japan, arrived at Katunayake Airport this morning (10) after completing his trip, airport officials confirmed.

title: Matara station lacks timetable announcements, Frustrates commuters
byline: Commuters at Matara Railway Station have expressed frustration over the lack of announcements regarding train schedules.

title: ‘Tinker’ deported from Dubai, arrested at BIA
byline: Sridharan Niranjan, also known as ‘Tinker,’ who was deported from Dubai, was taken into custody by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning.

title: Rugby World Cup draw set for December 3
byline: The draw for an expanded 2027 Rugby World Cup will take place on December 3, organisers said Wednesday, with hosts Australia confirmed as kicking off the tournament at Perth Stadium.

title: India-Sri Lanka CWC25 opener sets new attendance record
byline: The ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 got off to a historic start in Guwahati with the opener between India and Sri Lanka setting a new opening day attendance record at any Women’s Cricket World Cup.

title: US cities should be military training grounds, Trump tells generals
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he wants to use American cities as ’’training grounds’’ for the military.

title: TID recovers 10 hand grenades; Hunt on for more
byline: The Terrorist Investigation Division (TID), probing suspects who fled with 100 hand grenades, recovered 10 of them in Modara yesterday.

title: Passport, visa services continue despite US funding gap
byline: Passport and visa services in the United States and at U.S. Embassies and Consulates overseas will continue during the lapse in appropriations, the U.S. Embassy in Colombo announced.

title: US government shuts down after Democrats refuse to back Republican funding plan
byline: The US government shut down on Wednesday, after congressional Democrats refused to support a Republican plan to extend funding for federal departments unless they won a series of concessions centered on healthcare.
